job_title: Administrative Support Staff in Gainesville, FL
pros:
There is a great deal of passion in all Haven staff for the patients and families that are served. Everyone is told by management that they all serve a purpose in caring for those that are at end of life. Every job is important so that is a great feeling because it makes you feel that what you are doing matters. Co-workers are great to work with and I've never had a negative situation that couldn't easily be resolved.

Work life balance in most administrative areas seems to be positive. The work shift is standard M-F, 8-5 unless you're on call. The Gainesville location is on a beautiful campus with restaurants and stores nearby. This is convenient for those who don't want to stay in for lunch every day. Communication between staff is good for the most part. There are many different ways to communicate; phone, text, chat, email, etc. I enjoy the employee newsletter that is issued monthly.

Employees are provided with the equipment needed to do the job. There is good support from IT and the training department. Performance reviews are done on a regular basis so there are no surprises. Salary increases happen annually IF their census and money is available. Bonuses are offered if there is money left over (this is a non-profit organization). The company encourages manager/employee one-on-one meetings so you have a chance to meet with your manager regularly. There are also all-employee town hall meetings with executive presentations.

Haven Attic stores are fantastic. Even though employees don't get discounts, it's encouraging to know all this money goes directly to patient care.

Haven is a good company to work for, and as long as you do your job well, you will succeed and have a nice work experience.
cons: While executives are trying to do better with communication, some managers are not communicating with their down lines. Executives cannot assume that information is being distributed throughout the organization.

review_title: Great group of people to work with
job_title: Care Center Nurse in Gainesville, FL
pros: Great teamwork, satisfies desire to truly make a difference through your career path. Strong upper management team.
cons: Unpredictable work day at times due to patient needs/acuity/admissions. Highly emotional patient and family stressors can be difficult to balance with self care.

review_title: Compassion, Dignity, Honor, Friendship, Love...Just a few things  you will find and give on your journey at Haven.
pros: Helping suffering people feel a little better at the end of life; developing a strong sense of purpose and meaning in life; opportunities to develop and grow professionally,  and personally; develop skills in a high expectation, respectful compassionate mentoring,  deeply meaningful and rewarding environment; competitive market sensitive salary; parent company Santa Fe offers top tier benefits compared with other hospice related fields in this area.
cons:
Hospice work in the medical field is unique in that every patient you help, comfort,  and offer love and support to will die. If that is a struggle for you,  and you work in direct patient care,  it could be a difficult journey for you.  
Haven is primarily a hospice organization which utilizes a "team approach " to patient care. If you are a "solo soldier," don't enjoy teamwork and trusting others, and need everything on your shoulders, it could be a difficult journey for you at Haven. 
At times the work seems overwhelming,  I have had to and am still developing my ability to ask for help when it seems overwhelming.  If you are unable to ask for help or unwilling to grow in this area, your journey here will be difficult.  *note- when I have asked for help so far someone has always offered support,  often more than one person.

pros: Teamwork. Caring and loving environment
cons: Pay scale is not up to date. benefits ok but don’t compare to other companies

pros: Nice people, friendly environment, work independently
cons: Little opportunity to work with patients, mostly food service, no raises for PRN ever

pros: Compassionate and caring staff providing superior care to family and patients
cons: Our hearts are saddened by the hurt in the family hearts losing their loved one.

job_title: Patient Care Manager in Gainesville, FL
pros: Haven represents and supports patient and family centered care.  As a RN in the field -you are given the opportunity and autonomy to manage the  patient's care  in their homes with the assistance of a multidisciplinary team that includes physicians, social workers,  certified nursing assistants , chaplains, and managers.  With a caseload of about 16 to 18 patients you are responsible for pain and symptom management along with the input of the team.  Patient and family teaching is of utmost importance  to provide information that can be understand and utilized.  Our goal is to provide a secure and symptom free environment for the patient in their own homes as long as possible.  However, there is  a beautiful  and serene care center that the patient and family can transfer to at anytime they feel they need advanced care and support.  The focus is on the patient- at all times.
cons: The possibility of increased emotional stress is balanced by the opportunity to make such a difference in a patient's end of  life experience.

review_title: Haven Used to be so much better
pros: Most of the clinical staff care for their patients and co-workers. The nurses and physicians work well together, great CNA's. I love the team I work with.
cons: Horrible upper management and administration. New policies and programs implemented without input from clinical staff that are expected to carry plan out (and you better keep your mouth shut while doing it). Most of us work salaries and get paid for 40 hr week but end up working 60-80 depending on week. Now nurses are expected to be on call to do admissions until 7pm and admissions take appx 5 hrs to do.

pros: I truly love working for Haven Hospice!!! The thought and caring of every department is always felt. It is rewarding to make such a difference in the most difficult times of people’s lives. The management is understanding of work/life balance. They are always there to help teach you and allow for growth in the workplace.
cons: It can be emotionally draining as we are there for peoples most difficult times. The company is very understanding of this and has steps in place to help with this.

review_title: No system training in job, fight for yourself and lack of team direction
pros: Clean office and some of the staff is friendly. Normal hours and on a side road with sidewalks to use as exercise breaks.
cons: Upper management may be causing harsh culture and attitude carries down into staff. Spend more time showing volunteers work than actually doing it yourself which also puts you behind more due to correction of those errors and showing them how to do things.

review_title: I love my job as a Hospice CNA!  The work can be challenging at times but it is very rewarding!
pros:
Benefits
Great team work/ coworkers
pay is good to great
Co-workers truly care
Employer actually works on improving areas to make it a better place to work
Nice recognition for veterans
Great volunteer program
cons:
When working rural areas it’s sometimes difficult to see the number of patients as required. 
New phones are time consuming and many times addressses are not found. 
This year CNA week was different than the past. Less recognition.

review_title: Make a difference by helping others!
pros:
Wonderful opportunities to connect with patient and families who are in need of a special support at an important time in their life.
I leave work feeling like I made a difference in someone’s life.
Haven has a mission statement to provide comfort, care and compassion and that is a wonderful “business model”
I am honored to be a part of this organization!
cons:
Can be very hectic at times and I sometimes feel like I have too much to do.
Stressful work to be around people who are dying and families

job_title: RN Charge Nurse in Jacksonville, FL
pros: I'd say the biggest PRO for Haven would be the families we serve, day in, day out. Without them, there wouldn't be a HAVEN!
cons:
Where do I start
If you are  looking for a place to work, I'd just say its a mess. 

Haven barley has ANY staff. With all the changes in LEADERSHIP and business ways, its caused a large amount of staff to resign. Leaving the pressure on US CRAZY ones for staying. 

In the last 3 months, nearly EVERY EXECUTIVE LEADER has resigned on little notice. And they call our company a safe HAVEN? 

All the positive reviews you see post are very recent. HR has recently asked the staff in our Quarterly Town Hall meeting to go on Glassdoor and leave a positive review so we can attract new staff members. The same VP that responds to all the reviews left on here and other sites. Trying to make HAVEN look like the place to be.

You are over worked, expected to be a team player, when your TEAM is almost none. 

Most of the PCM's are WELL below ideal Manager Material. As long as they don't have to put in any man hours, they stay afloat. They are the first ones to yell TEAMWORK and leave the TEAM behind. Will act like they care about THEIR STAFF but only to protect them. As long as those "bonuses" look nice, thats all they care about.

So overall, I wouldn't ask a soul if they'd wanna work at Haven. Hopefully you fit in the "CLICK" so you sail through. With the Pres.resigning unexpectedly, Haven lost its most respected PIECE it had left!

review_title: Great Company - You won't regret it!!
pros:
1 hour lunch
Positivity
Busy

Culture
Everyone always has a positive attitude, a smile on their face, and is ready to help when they can! Management wants you to succeed!!

pros: Working at Haven provides opportunities to do meaningful work. The employees use their skills to truly make a difference in lives; being surrounded by such compassionate people is rare in a workplace.
cons: I have less paid holidays with Haven than I've had at other companies. This "con" is outweighed, though, by Haven's overall flexibility and understanding management.
